operations.notes: Creates a device entry for an application that is installed on an iOS device using a URL-encoded form. The application will call this API to register itself withe the RPS system. The RPS service will use this information to send notifications to devices that have installed this application.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant ID to create the device entry in

parameters.name: deviceToken
parameters.description: Device token value to store. It is base64 encoded.

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: Either phone or tablet.

parameters.name: isProduction
parameters.description: Is it for a Production app - true or false

parameters.name: isNewsstand
parameters.description: Is it for a Newsstand app - true or false

parameters.name: deviceDimension
parameters.description: Device screen size (example 1024x768)

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: Apple's bundleId

parameters.name: applicationVersion
parameters.description: Viewer version on device

parameters.name: userEntitlementId
parameters.description: Users entitlement ID or user identification

parameters.name: osVersion
parameters.description: iOS Version of the device

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User ID used for cross platform identification

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: HTTP Session ID

responseMessages.message: OK - device created or updated.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.

operations.notes: Creates a device entry for an application that is installed on an Android device using a multipart request. The application will call this API to register itself withe the RPS system. The RPS service will use this information to send notifications to devices that have installed this application.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant ID to create the device entry in

parameters.name: deviceToken
parameters.description: Device token value to store. It is base64 encoded.

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: Either phone or tablet.

parameters.name: deviceDimension
parameters.description: Device screen size (example 1024x768).

parameters.name: projectNumber
parameters.description: Android Project Number Similar to bundleId for Apple.

parameters.name: modelNumber
parameters.description: Model Number of device.

parameters.name: androidId
parameters.description: Android ID of device.

parameters.name: store
parameters.description: Android Store. Currently only "Google Play" supported.

parameters.name: applicationVersion
parameters.description: Application version on device.

parameters.name: osVersion
parameters.description: Android OS version.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User ID used for cross platform identification.

parameters.name: userEntitlementId
parameters.description: Users entitlement ID or user identification.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: HTTP Session ID.

responseMessages.message: OK - device created or updated.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.

operations.notes: Creates a device entry for an application that is installed on an Android device using URL-encoded form. The application will call this API to register itself withe the RPS system. The RPS service will use this information to send notifications to devices that have installed this application.

operations.summary: Gets the number of devices for this account/projectName.
operations.notes: Returns whether this request has any valid devices based on applicationId (for iOS, isProdcution will be used to further refine the search based on production or sandbox devices.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant Id

parameters.name: projectNumber
parameters.description: Projectnumber used to check for registered android devices

parameters.name: segmentDef
parameters.description: Segmentation definition used to filter the devices IDs

responseMessages.message: OK - determined if there are any devices for the given applicationId.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.

operations.summary: Gets the number of devices for this account/nameIdentifier.
operations.notes: Returns whether this request has any valid devices based on applicationId (for iOS, isProdcution will be used to further refine the search based on production or sandbox devices.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant Id

parameters.name: windowsNameIdentity
parameters.description: Name Identity used to check for registered windows devices

parameters.name: segmentDef
parameters.description: Segmentation definition used to filter the devices IDs

responseMessages.message: OK - determined if there are any devices for the given applicationId.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.

operations.summary: Gets the number of devices for this account/bundleId.
operations.notes: Returns whether this request has any valid devices based on applicationId (for iOS, isProdcution will be used to further refine the search based on production or sandbox devices.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant Id

parameters.name: isProduction
parameters.description: Is this a production app (this value is required)

parameters.name: bundleId
parameters.description: BundleId used to check for registered iOS devices

parameters.name: segmentDef
parameters.description: Segmentation definition used to filter the devices IDs

responseMessages.message: OK - determined if there are any devices for the given applicationId.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.

operations.notes: Creates a device entry for an application that is installed on a Windows device using a multipart request. The application will call this API to register itself withe the RPS system. The RPS service will use this information to send notifications to devices that have installed this application.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant ID to create the device entry in

parameters.name: deviceToken
parameters.description: ID for a specific Windows device.

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: Either phone or tablet.

parameters.name: deviceDimension
parameters.description: Device screen size (example 1024x768).

parameters.name: windowsNameIdentity
parameters.description: Windows Project Name.

parameters.name: windowsPublisherId
parameters.description: ID of application publisher. Can be used on multiple apps.

parameters.name: applicationVersion
parameters.description: Application version on device.

parameters.name: osVersion
parameters.description: Installed version of Windows.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User ID used for cross platform identification.

parameters.name: userEntitlementId
parameters.description: Users entitlement ID or user identification.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: HTTP Session ID.

responseMessages.message: OK - device created or updated.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.

operations.notes: Creates a device entry for an application that is installed on a Windows device using URL-encoded form. The application will call this API to register itself withe the RPS system. The RPS service will use this information to send notifications to devices that have installed this application.

parameters.name: x-notification-client-id
parameters.description: An identifier of the application (client) that is sending the notification.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant ID to create the device entry in

parameters.name: deviceToken
parameters.description: ID for a specific Windows device

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: Either Phone, Tablet or possibly Desktop

parameters.name: deviceDimension
parameters.description: Pixel dimensions of the target device

parameters.name: windowsNameIdentity
parameters.description: Windows Project Name

parameters.name: windowsPublisherId
parameters.description: ID of application publisher. Can be used on multiple apps.

parameters.name: applicationVersion
parameters.description: Version of the viewer

parameters.name: userEntitlementId
parameters.description: Users entitlement ID or user identification

parameters.name: osVersion
parameters.description: Installed version of Windows

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Common User ID

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: HTTP Session ID

responseMessages.message: OK - device created or updated.
Bad Request - if any of the required parameters are missing or invalid.
Forbidden - if requester does not have permission to perform this operation.
Service Unavailable - if any of the third party services are unavailable.
